value.title: Core Cloud Services - Introduction to Azure
value.excerpt: Create your first virtual machine as you discover the power of Azure cloud computing and storage, along with services that help you explore new software paradigms.

value.title: Quantum programming with Q# and running on hardware with Azure Quantum | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Mariia Mykhailova joins Scott Hanselman to discuss quantum computing and quantum programming with Microsoft Quantum Development Kit (QDK), from writing Q# code to running it on hardware via Azure Quantum.  ⏩ 0:00 – Intro ⏩ 0:51 – Overview ⏩ 5:43 – From algorithm to coding and unit tests ⏩ 20:58 – Jupyter

value.title: Azure Fundamentals part 6: Describe Azure cost management and service level agreements
value.excerpt: Learn about the factors that influence cost, tools you can use to help estimate and manage your cloud spend, and how Azure's service-level agreements (SLAs) can impact your application design decisions.

topItems.title: Plan and manage your Azure costs
topItems.excerpt: Migration to the cloud presents new ways to think about your IT expenses. This module teaches you about the factors that influence cost and tools you can use to help estimate and manage your cloud spend.

topItems.title: Choose the right Azure services by examining SLAs and service lifecycle
topItems.excerpt: Learn about service-level agreements (SLAs) in Azure, and how they can affect your application design decisions. See how to access preview services and learn how they affect your planning.

value.title: Choose the right Azure services by examining SLAs and service lifecycle

value.title: Choose the best Azure serverless technology for your compute scenario
value.excerpt: Examine Azure's serverless technologies and choose the right service for your scenario.

value.title: Learn how Microsoft supports cloud adoption as part of a cybersecurity solution
value.excerpt: The cloud fundamentally changes everything. Traditionally, ownership and responsibility for all aspects of the technology you use, from infrastructure to software, has fallen to enterprises. When you move to the cloud, you can instead provision and consume just the resources you need, when you need them. Although the cloud offers tremendous flexibility, to get the most benefit out of your move to the cloud, you need a proven and consistent methodology for adopting cloud technologies. The Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure meets that need, helping guide decisions throughout cloud adoption. This learning path provides an overview of the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure and how to use it as part of a cybersecurity solution.The deadline for agencies to update plans for federal network infrastructure, including adoption of cloud technology, and report those plans to OMB/NSC, per Section 3 of the Executive Order on Improving the Nation's Cybersecurity, is **July 11, 2021**.

topItems.title: Getting started with the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure
topItems.excerpt: CAF getting started. Use the Cloud Adoption Framework getting started guides to unblock your organization’s cloud adoption efforts

topItems.title: Build a cloud governance strategy on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to access policies, resource locks, and tags, as well as how Azure services such as Azure Policy and Azure Blueprints can help you build a comprehensive cloud governance strategy.

value.title: Build a cloud governance strategy on Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to access policies, resource locks, and tags, as well as how Azure services such as Azure Policy and Azure Blueprints can help you build a comprehensive cloud governance strategy.

value.title: Core Cloud Services - Azure architecture and service guarantees
value.excerpt: Learn about the Azure global network of physical datacenters, the physical architecture of Azure, how redundancy is provided, and Microsoft service guarantees.

value.title: Choose the best monitoring service for visibility, insight, and mitigation of service outages
value.excerpt: Discover solutions that help IT organizations with insights into the health and performance of their applications running in the cloud.

value.title: Plan and manage your Azure costs
value.excerpt: Migration to the cloud presents new ways to think about your IT expenses. This module teaches you about the factors that influence cost and tools you can use to help estimate and manage your cloud spend.

value.title: Choose the best tools to help organizations build better solutions
value.excerpt: Learn about Microsoft tools and services that help developers and operations engineers build modern solutions for the cloud and on-premises.

value.title: Explore roles and responsibilities in the world of data
value.excerpt: Explore roles and responsibilities in the world of data

value.title: Core Cloud Services - Azure compute options
value.excerpt: Explore essential Azure concepts to find out how virtual machines, containers, and apps combined with serverless computing services can fortify your business.

value.title: Explore computer vision in Microsoft Azure
value.excerpt: Computer vision is an area of artificial intelligence (AI) in which software systems are designed to perceive the world visually, though cameras, images, and video. There are multiple specific types of computer vision problem that AI engineers and data scientists can solve using a mix of custom machine learning models and platform-as-a-service (PaaS) solutions - including many cognitive services in Microsoft Azure.

topItems.title: Analyze images with the Computer Vision service
topItems.excerpt: The Computer Vision service enables software engineers to create intelligent solutions that extract information from images; a common task in many artificial intelligence (AI) scenarios.

topItems.title: Classify images with the Custom Vision service
topItems.excerpt: Image classification is a common workload in artificial intelligence (AI) applications. It harnesses the predictive power of machine learning to enable AI systems to identify real-world items based on images.

topItems.title: Detect objects in images with the Custom Vision service
topItems.excerpt: Object detection is a form of computer vision in which artificial intelligence (AI) agents can identify and locate specific types of object in an image or camera feed.

topItems.title: Detect and analyze faces with the Face service
topItems.excerpt: Face detection, analysis, and recognition is an important capability for artificial intelligence (AI) solutions. The Face cognitive service in Azure makes it easy integrate these capabilities into your applications.

value.title: Explore natural language processing
value.excerpt: Natural language processing supports applications that can see, hear, speak with, and understand users.  They permit the user to interact with your application in natural ways without requiring the user to adapt to the computer model.  Using text analytics, translation, and language understanding services, Microsoft Azure makes it easy to build applications that support natural language.

topItems.title: Analyze text with the Text Analytics service
topItems.excerpt: The Text Analytics service is a cloud-based service that provides advanced natural language processing over raw text for sentiment analysis, key phrase extraction, named entity recognition, and language detection.

topItems.title: Recognize and synthesize speech
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to recognize and synthesize speech by using Azure Cognitive Services.

topItems.title: Translate text and speech
topItems.excerpt: Automated translation capabilities in an AI solution enables closer collaboration by removing language barriers.

topItems.title: Create a language model with Language Understanding
topItems.excerpt: In this module, we'll introduce you to Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS) and show how to build and publish a LUIS model.

value.title: Core Cloud Services - Azure data storage options
value.excerpt: In this module, we'll explore the benefits of Azure data storage services versus on-premises storage.

value.title: Apply and monitor infrastructure standards with Azure Policy
value.excerpt: Learn about tools Azure provides for policy and standards management that support your teams' ownership and development of their resources in the cloud.

value.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure
value.excerpt: Discuss the basic concepts for protecting your infrastructure and data when you work in the cloud. Understand what responsibilities are yours and what Azure takes care of for you.

value.title: Azure Fundamentals part 4: Describe general security and network security features
value.excerpt: Learn about the various Azure services you can use to help ensure that your cloud resources are safe, secure, and trusted.

topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure can help you protect the workloads that you run both in the cloud and in your on-premises datacenter.

topItems.title: Secure network connectivity on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the Azure services you can use to help ensure that your network is safe, secure, and trusted.

value.excerpt: Learn about the decisions you make before creating a virtual machine, the options to create and manage the VM, and the extensions and services you use to manage your VM.

value.title: Create serverless applications
value.excerpt: In this learning path, discover Azure Functions that create event-driven, compute-on-demand systems using server-side logic to build serverless architectures.

topItems.title: Choose the best Azure service to automate your business processes
topItems.excerpt: In this module, we'll discuss how to choose the appropriate Azure service to integrate and automate business processes.

topItems.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions
topItems.excerpt: Azure Functions allow you to host business logic that can be executed without managing or provisioning server infrastructure

topItems.title: Execute an Azure Function with triggers
topItems.excerpt: This module demos some of the most common types of triggers for executing Azure Functions and how to configure them to execute your logic.

topItems.title: Chain Azure Functions together using input and output bindings
topItems.excerpt: In this module, we'll learn how to integrate your Azure Function with various data sources by using bindings.

value.title: Learn how Microsoft supports secure software development as part of a cybersecurity solution
value.excerpt: Secure software development means integrating security into each phase of your development lifecycle, from requirements analysis to maintenance. Microsoft provides many services that can help you develop more secure code and deploy a more secure application in the cloud. This learning path provides an overview of the services and offerings available to help you build secure software as part of a cybersecurity solution.The deadline for agencies to comply with NIST/CISA/OMB guidance on security measures for critical software (including applying practices of least privilege, network segmentation, and proper configuration), per section 4 of the Executive Order on Improving the Nation's Cybersecurity, is **August 10, 2021**. The deadline for agencies to comply with the guidance identifying practices that enhance the security of the software supply chain with respect to software procurement, also per section 4, is **March 8, 2022**.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Security
topItems.excerpt: Discover the tools that Azure provides to help you design a secure environment throughout your infrastructure, data, network, and applications.

topItems.title: Get started with Azure DevOps
topItems.excerpt: Explore Azure DevOps capabilities and get started setting up your own organization knowing what separates elite performers from low performers.

topItems.title: Introduction to GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn to use key GitHub features, including issues, notifications, branches, commits, and pull requests.

topItems.title: Maintain a secure repository by using GitHub best practices
topItems.excerpt: Learn best practices for building, hosting, and maintaining a secure repository on GitHub.

value.title: Choose the best tools for managing and configuring your Azure environment
value.excerpt: Explore the Azure management, administration, and reporting tools, and choose the ones that best meet your organization's needs.

value.title: Predict costs and optimize spending for Azure
value.excerpt: Discover how to use Azure pricing calculator, Azure Cost Management, and Azure Advisor to predict and manage cloud expenses.

value.title: Architect storage infrastructure in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to architect storage solutions for your applications in Azure.

topItems.title: Choose a data storage approach in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how using Azure Storage, Azure SQL Database, and Azure Cosmos DB - or a combination of them - for your business scenario is the best way to get the most performant solution.

topItems.title: Create an Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Discover ways to use an Azure Storage account to manage your data for billing, access, and storage location of your blobs, files, queues, and tables.

topItems.title: Upload, download, and manage data with Azure Storage Explorer
topItems.excerpt: Azure Storage Explorer allows you to quickly view all the storage services under your account. You can browse through, read, and edit data stored in those services through a user-friendly graphical interface.

topItems.title: Connect an app to Azure Storage
topItems.excerpt: Create a simple application and add configuration, client library references, and C# or JavaScript code to connect it to Azure Storage.

value.title: AZ-104: Implement and manage storage in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to manage storage in Azure and prepare for Exam AZ-104: Microsoft Azure Administrator.

topItems.title: Create an Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Discover ways to use an Azure Storage account to manage your data for billing, access, and storage location of your blobs, files, queues, and tables.

topItems.title: Choose the right disk storage for your virtual machine workload
topItems.excerpt: Azure provides a variety of disk storage options for virtual machine workloads. Identify the features of capabilities of each type to ensure your application performs optimally.

topItems.title: Provide disaster recovery by replicating storage data across regions and failing over to secondary location
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to provide disaster recovery by replicating storage data across regions and failing over to secondary location.

topItems.title: Secure your Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Storage provides multilayered security to protect your data with access keys, secure networks, and Advanced Threat Protection monitoring.
